summary: Ever wanted to play as Sheogorath? Want a mod that upholds some sense of lore and isn't insanely overpowered? We're the mod for you! Entrails not included, some assembly required!
descriptionHtml:
UPDATE: Woww. Totally forgot about this mod! Check the article section for a small update that I feel I should mention.

Hello! Welcome to Madgod's Holiday, my first Nexus mod that I decidedly brought over from my Steam workshop! This mod's main purpose isn't necessarily new - play as Sheogorath. But I figured to myself, "If I could make my own, how could I make it better?" Well, I figured that I'd make something a bit more balanced but still powerful, and thus Madgod's Holiday was born! 
The main perk about this mod is that it isn't insanely overpowered. You're not able to be killed easily, but that doesn't mean you can slay Miraak in one hit though. This mod also adds a few things for a genuine Sheogorath experience, such as some items and spells carried over from Oblivion's Shivering Isles and such.

[size=4]Full List of Madgod's Holiday's features: [/size]

1. Blessing of Mania: Based on the spell you get by entering the gates of Mania in the Shivering Isles, it will make anybody nearby go into a fit of frenzy. Pretty powerful, considering it works on up to level 75 people, but I tried to balance it out as a greater power, restricting it to one use a day. Also, do keep in mind you'll get assault bounty for using it. 

2. Blessing of Dementia: Based on the spell you get by entering the gates of Dementia in the Shivering Isles, it serves the same purpose as Mania's blessing does, save for panic rather than frenzy. Also, careful of the ensuing bounty. 

3. Summon Haskill(?): This is mostly a little joke on my part. It serves no purpose, really, and is merely there to show that piece of lore that people tend to forget - Haskill does NOT leave the Shivering Isles. You couldn't summon him in Cyrodiil, Skyrim goes no differently. Use it at your own risk, maybe even as a toy. 

4. Playing as Sheogorath: He's listed as a Madgod race, (because I felt savegames labeled Sheogorath, Level XX Sheogorath sounded ridiculous), and should be right above Nords. No need to customize him, he'll be all suited up to go in the character creator, all you need to do is name him. 

5. The Sword of Jyggalag: It's not much, but I figured it was a cute addition. It's a slightly more powerful Dwarven Greatsword that ignores damage resistance - practically the same as it was from Oblivion. 

6: Soul Tomato: I made a tomato that works in the same way as the Black Star, much like the item from Oblivion! Steal souls and ketchup to the lead!
 
7: Calming Pants: Considering there's no attributes in Skyrim such as Speed, Agility, or more specifically, Personality, the Calming Pants increase your bartering skills by 25%. 

8: Charity of Madness: It increases your shock, ice, and fire resistances by 10%! 

9: Haskill's Barrel: Look for it in Helgen Keep, where you enter as a Stormcloak and where you fight Stormcloaks as an Imperial. Be sure to check out the letter, too! 

10: Fork of Horripilation: It lacks the damage-magicka thingie, but it's perfectly functional! Find it inside Haskill's Barrel. (Script needs to be fixed.)

[size=5]FAQ: [/size]

1. Will this mod be incompatible with my x mod or y plugin? 
A: It shouldn't be! I still consider myself a newbie at modding, so if there's any incompatibilities, let me know, but I didn't do much except add things rather than change them. o-o 

2. SUMMON HASKILL DOESN'T WORK NOOB!!!
A: Please don't ask this. I stated above that Haskill does not leave the Shivering Isles, and it's merely a joke. I'm not planning on adding Haskill to the mod, if you want to do so, go hire his voice actor or something and I'll consider it.

3: It's not enough! We need more Sheogorath! D: 
A: Calm thyself, loyal denizen of the Shivering Isles! I WILL be adding on to this mod. I have a lot of plans for it and it's merely just begun. 

4: Where's the Sword of Jyggalag or Sheogorath's clothes? 
A: The Sword of Jyggalag and Sheogorath's clothes, as well as some other Shivering Isles items can be found in Helgen Keep, inside the round tall room where you enter as a Stormcloak or pass through as an Imperial. 

5: The Sword of Jyggalag is supposed to be white/silver!! 
A: The Sword of Jyggalag turned gold after Jyggalag's defeat. Nothing to fix here.[url=https://steamcommunity.com/linkfilter/?url=http://images.uesp.net/thumb/c/ce/SI-item-Sword_of_Jyggalag.png/180px-SI-item-Sword_of_Jyggalag.png]http://images.uesp.net/thumb/c/ce/SI-item-Sword_of_Jyggalag.png/180px-SI-item-Sword_of_Jyggalag.png[/url] 

[size=5]Plans:[/size]
[size=1](not necessarily in order of development)
[/size]
1. Gatekeeper follower and summonable Mazken and Auriel.

2. Cheese-related things - The most important part!! 

3. More balance-tweaking if I can. 

4. Possibly, I'm shooting out the door here, but POSSIBLY, a questline based around the fact you're playing as Sheogorath. Might be a seperate mod, may not happen, but I think it'd be cool if it did. x3

5. Amber and Madness Armor.

6. Player dialogue overhaul, to sound more like Sheogorath. Examples: "What have you got for sale?/Show me your wares, OR I'LL PLUCK OUT YOUR EYES!" "I'd rather die than go to prison!/This is going to be fun!" "Have a drink on me./Tell Sanguine I said hello, ahaha!"

Enjoy the mod! -Shanemagi
author: Shanemagi
